steps.title: BSF can mean â€œbest sister/sibling friend.â€
steps.content: BSF can mean â€œbest sister/sibling friend.â€ While it may not sound grammatically correct, a BSF here refers to someone with whom you are so close it feels like youâ€™re practically siblings rather than just friends. â€œSisterâ€™ and â€œsiblingâ€ are interchangeable here, but both pretty much get the message across that you all are basically inseparable. [1] X Research source

steps.title: BSF is also another way to say "Best friend.â€
steps.content: BSF is also another way to say "Best friend.â€ It appears that BFF (best friend forever) and BFFL (best friend for life) have met their match with this new abbreviation. Although, BSF seems to more often refer to a friend you feel is more like a sibling, similar to the â€œbest sister/sibling friendâ€ definition. Nevertheless, using BSF simply to mean â€œbest friendâ€ is totally acceptable. [2] X Research source You might also see it stylized as IBSF, which means â€œinternet best friend,â€ or someone you met over the internet through something like online gaming, a forum, or any other social media who became your friend.

steps.title: BSF can also stand for "But, seriously folks.â€
steps.content: BSF can also stand for "But, seriously folks.â€ This is a clever way to turn the conversation towards a new topic or get back on track if you find yourself getting lost in the endless spam of messages coming from your friends or family. Itâ€™s usually used to bring the conversation back to the main point after a joke or lighthearted comment was made, and will definitely catch everyoneâ€™s attention. [3] X Research source

steps.content: Let your friend know how much they mean to you. Of course youâ€™re invited to the party!â€

steps.content: Clarify your relationship to others. When someone gets the wrong idea about your relationship with your best friend, use this abbreviation to set the record straight. â€œWhat? OMG no heâ€™s not my boyfriend, heâ€™s my BSF. Weâ€™ve known each other since we were kids.â€ â€œWeâ€™re not just friends. Theyâ€™re my BSF.â€

steps.title: Use it as a standalone phrase to caption a photo.
steps.content: Use it as a standalone phrase to caption a photo. Even though BSF is only three little letters, its meaning is quite deep. So even if you just write â€œBSFâ€ to caption your Instagram post or let it stand alone in a tweet, people will definitely know what you mean. No extra explanations required.

steps.title: Replace BFF and BFFL.
steps.content: Replace BFF and BFFL. Letâ€™s face it, BFF and BFFL are so out, and BSF is totally in. Update your slang inventory by using BSF where you used to use BFF or BFFL. â€œHeâ€™s my BSF. I donâ€™t know what Iâ€™d do without him.â€ â€œWhoâ€™s your BSF?â€ â€œIâ€™ve known my BSF since preschool. Weâ€™re basically the same person by now.â€

steps.title: Compliment your friend.
steps.content: Compliment your friend. Even though they might already know it, your friend probably wouldnâ€™t mind hearing again just how much you value their friendship and how tight-knit your bond is. BSF conveys all of these emotions and much more. [4] X Research source â€œYou know youâ€™re my BSF right?â€ â€œWho needs them? I got my BSF right here! ğŸ˜ŠğŸ¥°â€ â€œYouâ€™re not just any friend. Youâ€™re my BSF!â€

steps.title: Use it to talk about your friends on the internet.
steps.content: Use it to talk about your friends on the internet. Best friends donâ€™t just have to be people you know in the real world. Thanks to technology, we can meet friends all around the world through the magic that is the internet. You can use BSF and also IBSF (internet best friend) to talk about your digital bestie. â€œMy BSF and I met on an internet forum and bonded over our love of cats ğŸ±ğŸˆâ€ â€œTheyâ€™re my IBSF. I wish we could meet in person though.â€ â€œMy IBSF is so cool ğŸ¥ºâ€

steps.title: Bring the conversation back on track.
steps.content: Bring the conversation back on track. Itâ€™s easy to go off on random tangents, especially when youâ€™re in a group chat with lots of people who all have different things to say. If you want to circle back to a point thatâ€™s pretty much gotten lost in the slew of messages, get everyoneâ€™s attention with these three letters. â€œğŸ™‹BSF can we get back to what we were originally talking about?â€ â€œBSF are we actually going to ignore the fact that no one passed that test?ğŸ‘€â€ â€œBSF letâ€™s talk about how birds are living dinosaurs again.â€

steps.title: Put some emphasis on your words.
steps.content: Put some emphasis on your words. Add some strength to your words by calling attention to them with this abbreviation and let the recipient know that youâ€™re not joking around. â€œBSF I actually do really want to go to Paris at some point.â€ â€œBSF Iâ€™m so lost on this project ğŸ˜­ Help.â€ â€œBSF I need someone to explain the situation to me again.â€

steps.title: Steer the conversation towards a more serious topic.
steps.content: Steer the conversation towards a more serious topic. The â€œseriousâ€ in â€œBut, seriously folksâ€ comes into play here, and you can use this as a means to bring up something that might not be as light as what you were previously talking about. â€œBSF what do yâ€™all think about the protests happening?â€ â€œBSF did you hear about what happened yesterday?â€ â€œBSF have you been following the news?

steps.title: Bible Study Fellowship.
steps.content: Bible Study Fellowship. This is a community that offers in-depth studies of the Bible to people all around the world and is a means for people to connect and meet up with others in their community. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Border Security Force.
steps.content: Border Security Force. This is Indiaâ€™s border guarding force that looks after the borders it shares with Pakistan and Bangladesh.

steps.title: Bachelor of Science in Forestry (B.S.F.).
steps.content: Bachelor of Science in Forestry (B.S.F.). BSF can also be a type of degree you earn at university. You might have heard of a B.A. (Bachelor of Arts) or B.S. (Bachelor of Science), but some universities offer an even more specified degree. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Stay on top of new texting slang with these common acronyms.
steps.content: Stay on top of new texting slang with these common acronyms. Learn these popular slang terms to stay in the know and keep your texts looking like English instead of gibberish: ISK : A typo for IDK (â€œI donâ€™t knowâ€) or â€œI should knowâ€ IDM : â€œI donâ€™t mindâ€ MCM : â€œMan crush Mondayâ€ WCW : â€œWoman crush Wednesdayâ€ MBN : â€œMust be niceâ€ FFF : â€œFollow for followâ€ PMO : â€œPut me onâ€ (introduce to someone or something) OOMF : â€œOne of my followersâ€ or â€œone of my friendsâ€ OMW â€™â€™: â€œOn my wayâ€
